newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Bioscience amends Schering-Plough pact.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Bioscience amends Schering-Plough pact.

text.p: U.S. Bioscience Inc said on Tuesday it and Schering-Plough Corp amended their 1993 European distribution agreement for U.S. Bioscience's Ethyol drug.

Under the deal, effective retroactively to January 1, 1996, Schering-Plough's exclusive marketing period will be extended by two years, through 2003, and Schering-Plough will provide U.S. Bioscience with a net incremental payment of $3.4 million, U.S. Bioscience said.

Schering-Plough will also buy Ethyol from U.S. Bioscience at a price based on a percent of net sales and U.S. Bioscience will no longer absorb certain promotional expenses previously shared by the parties.

Following the exclusive period, U.S. Bioscience may choose to enter into a two-year transition period in which U.S. Bioscience would co-promote Ethyol in Europe and afterwards all rights to market Ethyol in Europe would revert to U.S. Bioscience.
Ethyol is a cytoprotective drug which, when given prior to treatment, can protect healthy cells from the damaging effects of chemotherapy.
